details:
Brief introduction


* [CVE-2017-17742](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17742)
Response Splitting attack in the HTTP server of WEBrick.
* [CVE-2019-8320](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8320)
Delete directory using symlink when decompressing tar.
* [CVE-2019-8321](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8321)
Escape sequence injection vulnerability in verbose.
* [CVE-2019-8322](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8322)
Escape sequence injection vulnerability in gem owner.
* [CVE-2019-8323](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8323)
Escape sequence injection vulnerability in API response handling.
* [CVE-2019-8324](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8324)
Installing a malicious gem may lead to arbitrary code execution.
* [CVE-2019-8325](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-8325)
Escape sequence injection vulnerability in errors.
* [CVE-2019-16201](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16201)
Regular Expression Denial of Service vulnerability of WEBrick's Digest access authentication.
* [CVE-2019-16254](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16254)
HTTP Response Splitting attack in the HTTP server of WEBrick.
* [CVE-2019-16255](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16255)
Code injection vulnerability.


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
1.7.26-1+deb9u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your jruby packages.


For the detailed security status of jruby please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/jruby>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
